summary: This document is an email correspondence involving Jeffrey Epstein and Jes Staley, discussing a forwarded message about new hires at UBS Private Bank. The email highlights significant personnel changes at UBS, including the hiring of Alexander Friedman, Mona Sutphen, and Mark Haefele, and reflects UBS's efforts to recover from previous financial issues.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Jes Staley is involved in an email exchange with Jeffrey Epstein regarding new hires at UBS Private Bank.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary recipient of the email and is mentioned as the owner of the communication's content.

persons.name: Boris Nikolic
persons.context: Boris Nikolic is mentioned as the sender of a forwarded message regarding UBS's new hires.

persons.name: Alexander Friedman
persons.context: Alexander Friedman is noted as the new chief investment officer at UBS Private Bank, having previously worked for the Gates Foundation.

persons.name: Mona Sutphen
persons.context: Mona Sutphen is mentioned as a new hire at UBS, previously a Deputy Chief of Staff at the White House.

persons.name: Mark Haefele
persons.context: Mark Haefele is introduced as a new hire at UBS, responsible for investment analysis.

keyFacts: The email discusses new hires at UBS Private Bank, including Alexander Friedman, Mona Sutphen, and Mark Haefele.
Jeffrey Epstein is identified as the owner of the communication and is involved in the discussion.
The document reflects UBS's efforts to recover from financial issues and manage wealthy-client outflows.
Boris Nikolic is mentioned as the sender of a forwarded message regarding UBS's new hires.
The email contains a confidentiality notice indicating the communication is intended for the addressee only.
